tool_description: Affordable forward geocoding, reverse geocoding, routing and map tile APIs. Provides accurate and scalable APIs.
name: LocationIQ
title: LocationIQ

api_list.name: limitByViewbox
api_list.description:
Specify the preferred area to find search results.

> The Autocomplete API is a variant of the Search API that returns place predictions in response to an HTTP request. The request specifies a textual search string and optional geographic bounds. The service can be used to provide autocomplete functionality for text-based geographic searches, by returning places such as businesses, addresses and points of interest as a user types.

> The Autocomplete API can match on full words as well as substrings. Applications can therefore send queries as the user types, to provide on-the-fly place predictions.

optional_parameters.name: bounded
optional_parameters.description: Restrict result to items contained within the bounds specified in the viewbox parameter [0] [1]

optional_parameters.name: key
optional_parameters.description: Your API key

optional_parameters.name: viewbox
optional_parameters.description: The preferred area to find search results. Any two corner points of the box - max_lon,max_lat,min_lon,min_lat or min_lon,min_lat,max_lon,max_lat - are accepted in any order as long as they span a real box. Currently, this option in the Autocomplete API only increases weigtage of results inside the viewbox. It does not restrict results to this box.

optional_parameters.name: q
optional_parameters.description: Query string to search for

api_list.name: listOfAllNearbyPoIsExceptGyms
api_list.description: The Nearby Points of Interest (PoI) API returns specified PoIs or Places around a given coordinate.

optional_parameters.name: lat
optional_parameters.description: Latitude of the location to generate the PoI list for.

optional_parameters.name: key
optional_parameters.description: Authentication Key

optional_parameters.name: tag
optional_parameters.description: PoI to generate the list for. Defaults to country (check Nearby-Countries).

optional_parameters.name: lon
optional_parameters.description: Longitude of the location to generate the PoI list for.

api_list.name: generalUsage
api_list.description: The Timezone API provides time offset data for locations on the surface of the earth.

optional_parameters.name: lat
optional_parameters.description: Latitude of the location

optional_parameters.name: key
optional_parameters.description: Authentication key

optional_parameters.name: lon
optional_parameters.description: Longitude of the location

api_list.name: generalUsage

optional_parameters.name: key
optional_parameters.description: Your API Access Token

api_list.name: postalCodeQuery
api_list.description:
It takes postalcode & countrycode as input.

> The Search API allows converting addresses, such as a street address, into geographic coordinates (latitude and longitude). These coordinates can serve various use-cases, from placing markers on a map to helping algorithms determine nearby bus stops. This process is also known as Forward Geocoding.

optional_parameters.name: format
optional_parameters.description: Output Format [json | xml]

optional_parameters.name: key
optional_parameters.description: Your API Key

optional_parameters.name: countrycodes
optional_parameters.description: Limit search to a list of countries.

optional_parameters.name: postalcode
optional_parameters.description: Alternative query string format for postal code requests that uses a special postal code dataset for geocoding. Do not combine with q=<query> or other structured parameters for postal code search. Combine with countrycodes=<countrycode> parameter for a better response

api_list.name: fixedSourceDestination
api_list.description: Round trip in London with four stops, starting at the first stop, ending at the last.

required_parameters.name: service
required_parameters.description: One of the following values: directions, matching, matrix, nearest, optimize

required_parameters.name: profile
required_parameters.description: Mode of transportation. Only driving is supported at the moment.

required_parameters.name: coordinates
required_parameters.description:
String of format {longitude},{latitude};{longitude},{latitude}[;{longitude},{latitude} ...] or polyline({polyline}) or polyline6({polyline6}).
polyline follows Google's polyline format with precision 5

optional_parameters.name: source
optional_parameters.description: Returned route starts at any or first coordinate [ any | first ]

optional_parameters.name: destination
optional_parameters.description: Returned route ends at any or last coordinate [ any | last ]

api_list.name: generalUsage
api_list.description: The Balance API provides a count of request credits left in the user's account for the day. Balance is reset at midnight UTC everyday (00:00 UTC).

api_list.name: usingOsmIdType
api_list.description:
It takes OSM ID & Type as input.

> Reverse geocoding with OSM ID & Type is the process of converting an object represented by OSM ID and Type ( node, way and relations [N,W,R] ) to a readable address or place name. This permits the identification of nearby street addresses, places, and/or area subdivisions such as a neighborhood, county, state, or country.

optional_parameters.name: key
optional_parameters.description: Authentication key.

optional_parameters.name: osm_type
optional_parameters.description: A specific osm type, node / way / relation to search an address for [ N, W , R ], only applicable when neither (lat lon) is present. That is use in combination osm_id and osm_type or lat and lon to get result

optional_parameters.name: osm_id
optional_parameters.description: A specific osm node / way / relation to return an address for

optional_parameters.name: format
optional_parameters.description: Output Format. Defaults to xml
